description: Application loads and displays the main three-pane layout with left rail, queue pane, and work pane
steps: Step 1: Navigate to the application root URL
Step 2: Wait for the page to fully load
Step 3: Verify the left rail navigation (64px width) is visible with logo and navigation icons
Step 4: Verify the queue pane (320-400px width) is visible with search bar and filter controls
Step 5: Verify the work pane (flexible width) is visible and takes remaining space
Step 6: Verify all three panes are responsive and properly positioned

description: User can log in with valid Supabase Auth credentials
steps: Step 1: Navigate to the login page
Step 2: Enter valid email address in the email field
Step 3: Enter valid password in the password field
Step 4: Click the login button
Step 5: Verify redirect to the main moderation dashboard
Step 6: Verify user session is established and agent status is displayed

description: Login form displays validation errors for invalid credentials
steps: Step 1: Navigate to the login page
Step 2: Enter invalid email address
Step 3: Enter invalid password
Step 4: Click the login button
Step 5: Verify error message is displayed indicating invalid credentials
Step 6: Verify user remains on login page

description: User can log out and session is properly terminated
steps: Step 1: Log in with valid credentials
Step 2: Navigate to settings or user menu
Step 3: Click the logout button
Step 4: Verify redirect to login page
Step 5: Attempt to access protected route
Step 6: Verify redirect back to login page confirming session is terminated

description: Protected routes redirect unauthenticated users to login
steps: Step 1: Clear all session data/cookies
Step 2: Attempt to navigate directly to the moderation dashboard URL
Step 3: Verify automatic redirect to login page
Step 4: Verify the intended destination is preserved for post-login redirect

description: Queue pane displays list of moderation posts with PostCard components
steps: Step 1: Log in as an agent
Step 2: Navigate to the moderation dashboard
Step 3: Verify queue pane shows list of posts as PostCard components
Step 4: Verify each PostCard displays priority strip, title, excerpt, and metadata
Step 5: Verify posts are sorted by priority (P1 first)
Step 6: Verify post count or queue size indicator is visible

description: PostCard displays vertical priority strip with correct color coding
steps: Step 1: Navigate to the moderation queue
Step 2: Locate a P1 (Critical) priority post
Step 3: Verify the priority strip is Red-500 (#ef4444)
Step 4: Locate a P2 (High) priority post
Step 5: Verify the priority strip is Orange-400 (#fb923c)
Step 6: Locate a P3 (Medium) priority post
Step 7: Verify the priority strip is Slate-400 (#94a3b8)
Step 8: Locate a P4 (Low) priority post
Step 9: Verify the priority strip is Emerald-400 (#34d399)

description: PostCard displays sentiment icon with appropriate visual indicator
steps: Step 1: Navigate to the moderation queue
Step 2: Locate a post with negative sentiment
Step 3: Verify negative sentiment icon is displayed with appropriate color
Step 4: Locate a post with neutral sentiment
Step 5: Verify neutral sentiment icon is displayed
Step 6: Locate a post with positive sentiment
Step 7: Verify positive sentiment icon is displayed with appropriate color

description: User can filter posts by category using dropdown
steps: Step 1: Navigate to the moderation queue
Step 2: Locate the category filter dropdown
Step 3: Click to open the dropdown
Step 4: Select a specific category
Step 5: Verify queue updates to show only posts in selected category
Step 6: Verify filter indicator shows active filter
Step 7: Clear the filter and verify all posts are shown again

description: User can filter posts by status (Open, In Progress, Resolved)
steps: Step 1: Navigate to the moderation queue
Step 2: Locate the status filter control
Step 3: Select 'Open' status filter
Step 4: Verify only open posts are displayed
Step 5: Select 'In Progress' status filter
Step 6: Verify only in-progress posts are displayed
Step 7: Select 'Resolved' status filter
Step 8: Verify only resolved posts are displayed

description: User can filter posts by priority level (P1-P5)
steps: Step 1: Navigate to the moderation queue
Step 2: Locate the priority filter control
Step 3: Select P1 (Critical) filter
Step 4: Verify only P1 priority posts are displayed
Step 5: Select multiple priorities (P1 and P2)
Step 6: Verify posts matching either priority are displayed
Step 7: Clear priority filters
Step 8: Verify all posts are shown

description: User can filter posts by date range
steps: Step 1: Navigate to the moderation queue
Step 2: Locate the date range filter
Step 3: Set start date to one week ago
Step 4: Set end date to today
Step 5: Apply the date filter
Step 6: Verify only posts within the date range are displayed
Step 7: Verify posts outside the range are not shown

description: Full-text search finds posts by title content
steps: Step 1: Navigate to the moderation queue
Step 2: Locate the search bar
Step 3: Enter a search term that matches a post title
Step 4: Verify search results update in real-time or on submit
Step 5: Verify matching posts are displayed
Step 6: Verify non-matching posts are filtered out
Step 7: Clear search and verify all posts return

description: Full-text search finds posts by body content
steps: Step 1: Navigate to the moderation queue
Step 2: Enter a search term that appears only in post body (not title)
Step 3: Submit the search
Step 4: Verify posts containing the term in body content are returned
Step 5: Verify search highlights or indicates matched content

description: User can toggle between Grid View and List View
steps: Step 1: Navigate to the moderation queue
Step 2: Locate the view toggle control
Step 3: Verify default view is displayed (Grid or List)
Step 4: Click to switch to alternative view
Step 5: Verify posts are re-rendered in the new view format
Step 6: Toggle back to original view
Step 7: Verify view preference persists across page navigation

description: Grid View displays posts as card components with consistent sizing
steps: Step 1: Navigate to the moderation queue
Step 2: Switch to Grid View if not already active
Step 3: Verify posts are displayed as cards in a grid layout
Step 4: Verify cards have consistent width and height
Step 5: Verify grid responds to container width changes

description: List View displays posts in compact horizontal rows
steps: Step 1: Navigate to the moderation queue
Step 2: Switch to List View
Step 3: Verify posts are displayed as compact horizontal rows
Step 4: Verify essential information (title, priority, status) is visible
Step 5: Verify more posts are visible per screen compared to Grid View

description: User can sort posts by Priority (default)
steps: Step 1: Navigate to the moderation queue
Step 2: Locate the sort dropdown
Step 3: Select 'Priority' as sort option
Step 4: Verify P1 posts appear first, then P2, P3, P4, P5
Step 5: Verify sort order indicator shows Priority as active

description: User can sort posts by Date (newest first)
steps: Step 1: Navigate to the moderation queue
Step 2: Select 'Date' as sort option from dropdown
Step 3: Verify posts are ordered by creation date descending
Step 4: Verify newest posts appear at the top
Step 5: Verify sort order indicator shows Date as active

description: User can sort posts by Status
steps: Step 1: Navigate to the moderation queue
Step 2: Select 'Status' as sort option
Step 3: Verify posts are grouped by status (Open first, then In Progress, then Resolved)
Step 4: Verify sort order indicator shows Status as active

description: Clicking a post auto-assigns it to the current agent
steps: Step 1: Log in as Agent A
Step 2: Navigate to the moderation queue
Step 3: Find an unassigned post in the queue
Step 4: Click on the post
Step 5: Verify the post detail view opens in the work pane
Step 6: Verify the post is now assigned to Agent A
Step 7: Verify the assigned_at timestamp is set
Step 8: Verify the post card in queue shows assignment indicator

description: Post detail view displays full post content
steps: Step 1: Navigate to the moderation queue
Step 2: Click on a post to open detail view
Step 3: Verify post header shows post ID and action buttons
Step 4: Verify full post title is displayed
Step 5: Verify full post body content is displayed
Step 6: Verify post metadata (author, date, category) is visible
Step 7: Verify any attachments are displayed or linked

description: Post detail view shows user context sidebar
steps: Step 1: Open a post in the detail view
Step 2: Locate the user context sidebar
Step 3: Verify author's sentiment indicator is displayed
Step 4: Verify author's post history count is shown
Step 5: Verify author's total post count is displayed
Step 6: Verify context information helps agent understand user's situation

description: Post detail view shows activity history timeline
steps: Step 1: Open a post that has previous activity
Step 2: Scroll to the activity history section
Step 3: Verify timeline shows all actions in chronological order
Step 4: Verify each entry shows action type, agent, and timestamp
Step 5: Verify responses and internal notes are listed in timeline

description: Agent can release assigned post back to the pool
steps: Step 1: Open a post that is assigned to the current agent
Step 2: Locate the release or unassign button
Step 3: Click the release button
Step 4: Confirm release action if prompted
Step 5: Verify post is no longer assigned to the agent
Step 6: Verify post appears in the unassigned queue for other agents

description: Supervisor can manually reassign post to another agent
steps: Step 1: Log in as Supervisor
Step 2: Open a post that is assigned to Agent A
Step 3: Open the reassign menu (Cmd+Shift+A or button)
Step 4: Select Agent B from the list of available agents
Step 5: Confirm the reassignment
Step 6: Verify post is now assigned to Agent B
Step 7: Verify audit log records the reassignment action

description: Agent status shows Online when active
steps: Step 1: Log in as an agent
Step 2: Verify agent status indicator shows Online
Step 3: Verify status is visible in the left rail
Step 4: Verify other agents can see this agent's Online status

description: Agent can set status to Busy
steps: Step 1: Log in as an agent
Step 2: Click on agent status indicator
Step 3: Select 'Busy' status option
Step 4: Verify status updates to Busy
Step 5: Verify status change is visible to other agents
Step 6: Verify agent can still work but signals unavailability for new assignments

description: Agent status changes to Offline on logout or inactivity
steps: Step 1: Log in as Agent A from two browser sessions
Step 2: In session 2, observe Agent A shows as Online
Step 3: Log out from session 1
Step 4: Verify session 2 shows Agent A status changed to Offline
Step 5: Verify last_active_at timestamp is updated

description: Real-time presence shows which agent is viewing a post
steps: Step 1: Log in as Agent A in browser 1
Step 2: Log in as Agent B in browser 2
Step 3: Agent A opens a specific post
Step 4: Agent B views the same post in queue
Step 5: Verify Agent B sees 'Agent A is viewing' indicator on that post
Step 6: Agent A navigates away from the post
Step 7: Verify the viewing indicator disappears for Agent B

description: Response editor displays with rich text formatting toolbar
steps: Step 1: Open a post in detail view
Step 2: Locate the response editor
Step 3: Verify formatting toolbar is visible with Bold, Italic, Underline options
Step 4: Verify Link insertion button is present
Step 5: Verify List formatting options are available
Step 6: Verify toolbar is accessible and functional

description: Agent can apply bold formatting to text in response
steps: Step 1: Open response editor
Step 2: Type some text
Step 3: Select a portion of the text
Step 4: Click the Bold button or use Ctrl/Cmd+B
Step 5: Verify selected text is formatted as bold
Step 6: Verify bold formatting is preserved in preview/submission

description: Agent can apply italic formatting to text in response
steps: Step 1: Open response editor
Step 2: Type some text
Step 3: Select a portion of the text
Step 4: Click the Italic button or use Ctrl/Cmd+I
Step 5: Verify selected text is formatted as italic

description: Agent can insert links in response text
steps: Step 1: Open response editor
Step 2: Type or select text to be linked
Step 3: Click the Link button
Step 4: Enter URL in the link dialog
Step 5: Confirm link insertion
Step 6: Verify text is now a clickable hyperlink
Step 7: Verify link URL is correctly stored

description: Agent can create bulleted and numbered lists in response
steps: Step 1: Open response editor
Step 2: Click bulleted list option
Step 3: Type list items pressing Enter between each
Step 4: Verify bullet points are displayed
Step 5: Switch to numbered list option
Step 6: Verify items are numbered sequentially
Step 7: Exit list mode and continue with normal text

description: Response editor auto-focuses when R key is pressed
steps: Step 1: Open a post in detail view
Step 2: Ensure focus is not in the response editor
Step 3: Press the R key
Step 4: Verify response editor receives focus
Step 5: Verify cursor is positioned ready for typing

description: Agent can post a response to a community post
steps: Step 1: Open an assigned post in detail view
Step 2: Type a response in the response editor
Step 3: Click the 'Post Reply' button
Step 4: Verify response is submitted successfully
Step 5: Verify response appears in the activity timeline
Step 6: Verify response is marked as not internal (visible to community)

description: Agent can add internal notes not visible to community
steps: Step 1: Open an assigned post
Step 2: Type a note in the response editor
Step 3: Click the 'Internal Note' button
Step 4: Verify note is saved successfully
Step 5: Verify note appears in activity timeline with internal indicator
Step 6: Verify note has is_internal_note flag set to true

description: Agent can post reply and resolve post with Cmd+Enter
steps: Step 1: Open an assigned post
Step 2: Type a response
Step 3: Press Cmd+Enter (or Ctrl+Enter)
Step 4: Verify response is posted
Step 5: Verify post status changes to Resolved
Step 6: Verify resolved_at timestamp is set
Step 7: Verify post moves to resolved section in queue

description: Template library displays available response templates
steps: Step 1: Open response editor
Step 2: Locate and click the template dropdown
Step 3: Verify list of available templates is displayed
Step 4: Verify templates show name and optional category
Step 5: Verify search/filter within template list works

description: Agent can insert a template into the response editor
steps: Step 1: Open response editor
Step 2: Open template dropdown
Step 3: Click on a template to select it
Step 4: Verify template content is inserted into editor
Step 5: Verify any placeholders are highlighted or editable
Step 6: Verify usage_count is incremented for the template

description: Admin can create new response templates
steps: Step 1: Log in as Admin
Step 2: Navigate to template management section
Step 3: Click 'Create Template' button
Step 4: Enter template name
Step 5: Enter template content with placeholders (e.g., {{username}})
Step 6: Optionally assign to a category
Step 7: Save the template
Step 8: Verify template appears in the template library

description: Admin can edit existing response templates
steps: Step 1: Log in as Admin
Step 2: Navigate to template management
Step 3: Locate an existing template
Step 4: Click edit button
Step 5: Modify template name or content
Step 6: Save changes
Step 7: Verify changes are reflected in template library

description: Admin can delete response templates
steps: Step 1: Log in as Admin
Step 2: Navigate to template management
Step 3: Locate a template to delete
Step 4: Click delete button
Step 5: Confirm deletion in confirmation dialog
Step 6: Verify template is removed from the library

description: Template placeholders are dynamically replaced with post context
steps: Step 1: Create a template with placeholder {{author_name}}
Step 2: Open a post from a specific author
Step 3: Insert the template into response editor
Step 4: Verify {{author_name}} is replaced with actual author's name
Step 5: Verify other placeholders like {{post_title}} work correctly

description: AI Suggest button generates response suggestion using RAG
steps: Step 1: Open a post in detail view
Step 2: Click the 'AI Suggest' button
Step 3: Verify loading indicator appears
Step 4: Verify AI-generated suggestion streams into the editor as ghost text
Step 5: Verify suggestion is contextually relevant to the post content
Step 6: Verify RAG retrieves similar past responses for context

description: Ghost text appears during AI suggestion streaming
steps: Step 1: Open a post and click AI Suggest
Step 2: Observe the response editor during streaming
Step 3: Verify text appears in a distinct ghost/preview style
Step 4: Verify ghost text updates in real-time as tokens stream
Step 5: Verify ghost text is visually distinct from confirmed text

description: Tab key accepts AI draft suggestion
steps: Step 1: Trigger AI suggestion on a post
Step 2: Wait for ghost text to appear
Step 3: Press the Tab key
Step 4: Verify ghost text is converted to confirmed text
Step 5: Verify the text can now be edited normally
Step 6: Verify suggestion acceptance is smooth and instant

description: Agent can dismiss AI suggestion and type manually
steps: Step 1: Trigger AI suggestion on a post
Step 2: Wait for ghost text to appear
Step 3: Start typing in the editor (not Tab)
Step 4: Verify ghost text is dismissed/replaced
Step 5: Verify agent can type their own response freely

description: Sentiment analysis is performed on new posts
steps: Step 1: Create or ingest a new post with clearly negative content
Step 2: Verify sentiment analysis runs automatically
Step 3: Verify sentiment_score is populated
Step 4: Verify sentiment_label is set (negative/neutral/positive)
Step 5: Verify sentiment icon is displayed on the post card

description: Priority rules automatically set priority for first-time posters
steps: Step 1: Create a new post from a user with fewer than 2 previous posts
Step 2: Verify the first-time poster rule is evaluated
Step 3: Verify post is automatically set to P2 priority
Step 4: Verify priority indicator reflects P2 status

description: Priority rules escalate posts with negative sentiment
steps: Step 1: Create a post with clearly negative sentiment content
Step 2: Verify sentiment analysis tags it as negative
Step 3: Verify sentiment-based escalation rule is triggered
Step 4: Verify post priority is elevated appropriately
Step 5: Verify escalation is logged in audit trail

description: SLA-based escalation raises priority for overdue posts
steps: Step 1: Configure SLA rule for posts unresponded after 2 hours
Step 2: Create a post and leave it unassigned
Step 3: Wait for (or simulate) 2+ hours passing
Step 4: Verify SLA escalation rule triggers
Step 5: Verify post priority is elevated
Step 6: Verify escalation is visible and logged

description: Admin can view and manage priority rules
steps: Step 1: Log in as Admin
Step 2: Navigate to Rules Management section
Step 3: Verify list of all priority rules is displayed
Step 4: Verify each rule shows name, condition, action, and status
Step 5: Verify rules are displayed in order of execution priority

description: Admin can create new priority rules
steps: Step 1: Log in as Admin
Step 2: Navigate to Rules Management
Step 3: Click 'Create Rule' button
Step 4: Enter rule name and description
Step 5: Select condition type and configure condition value
Step 6: Select action type and configure action value
Step 7: Save the rule
Step 8: Verify new rule appears in the rules list

description: Admin can edit existing priority rules
steps: Step 1: Log in as Admin
Step 2: Navigate to Rules Management
Step 3: Click edit on an existing rule
Step 4: Modify rule conditions or actions
Step 5: Save changes
Step 6: Verify rule is updated in the list

description: Admin can delete priority rules
steps: Step 1: Log in as Admin
Step 2: Navigate to Rules Management
Step 3: Click delete on a rule
Step 4: Confirm deletion
Step 5: Verify rule is removed from the list
Step 6: Verify rule no longer affects new posts

description: Admin can enable/disable priority rules
steps: Step 1: Log in as Admin
Step 2: Navigate to Rules Management
Step 3: Toggle a rule from active to inactive
Step 4: Verify rule status indicator changes
Step 5: Create a new post that would match the rule
Step 6: Verify disabled rule does not affect the post

description: Admin can drag-to-reorder priority rules
steps: Step 1: Log in as Admin
Step 2: Navigate to Rules Management
Step 3: Drag a rule from position 3 to position 1
Step 4: Verify rules reorder visually
Step 5: Verify position values are updated in database
Step 6: Verify new order affects rule evaluation priority

description: Admin can test priority rules against sample post
steps: Step 1: Log in as Admin
Step 2: Navigate to Rules Management
Step 3: Click 'Test Rules' button
Step 4: Enter sample post data (author post count, sentiment, etc.)
Step 5: Run the test
Step 6: Verify test shows which rules would match
Step 7: Verify expected priority result is displayed

description: Agent role has correct permissions (view queue, claim posts, respond)
steps: Step 1: Log in as user with Agent role
Step 2: Verify can view moderation queue
Step 3: Verify can claim/assign posts to self
Step 4: Verify can post responses and internal notes
Step 5: Verify cannot access admin settings
Step 6: Verify cannot manage rules or templates (if restricted)

description: Supervisor role can reassign posts and view team metrics
steps: Step 1: Log in as Supervisor
Step 2: Verify can view all queue items
Step 3: Verify can reassign posts between agents
Step 4: Verify can view team performance metrics
Step 5: Verify cannot modify system rules (if restricted to Admin)

description: Admin role has full access to all features
steps: Step 1: Log in as Admin
Step 2: Verify can access moderation queue
Step 3: Verify can access Rules Management
Step 4: Verify can access Template Management
Step 5: Verify can access User/Agent Management
Step 6: Verify can view audit logs
Step 7: Verify can modify system settings

description: Moderator role has moderation privileges but limited admin access
steps: Step 1: Log in as Moderator
Step 2: Verify can perform moderation actions
Step 3: Verify can access template library
Step 4: Verify limited access to admin-only features
Step 5: Verify role-appropriate menu items are shown

description: RLS policies prevent unauthorized data access
steps: Step 1: Create posts assigned to Agent A
Step 2: Attempt to access Agent A's assigned posts as Agent B via API
Step 3: Verify appropriate data is returned based on RLS
Step 4: Verify internal notes are not visible to unauthorized users
Step 5: Verify database-level security is enforced

description: Audit log records all agent actions
steps: Step 1: Log in as an agent
Step 2: Perform various actions (claim post, respond, release)
Step 3: Log in as Admin
Step 4: Navigate to audit log viewer
Step 5: Verify all actions are logged with agent_id, action_type, and timestamp
Step 6: Verify action_details JSON contains relevant context

description: Audit log captures previous and new state for changes
steps: Step 1: Change a post's priority from P3 to P1
Step 2: View the audit log entry for this change
Step 3: Verify previous_state shows P3
Step 4: Verify new_state shows P1
Step 5: Verify the change is traceable and attributable

description: Real-time sync updates queue within 2 seconds of changes
steps: Step 1: Open the moderation queue in two browser windows (Agent A and B)
Step 2: Agent A assigns a post to themselves
Step 3: Start timer
Step 4: Verify Agent B's queue updates to show assignment within 2 seconds
Step 5: Verify optimistic UI shows update even faster locally

description: Real-time sync updates post status changes across clients
steps: Step 1: Open same post in two browser windows
Step 2: In window 1, change post status to Resolved
Step 3: Verify window 2 reflects the status change in real-time
Step 4: Verify status badge updates without page refresh

description: Optimistic UI shows instant feedback for local actions
steps: Step 1: Click to assign a post
Step 2: Verify UI immediately shows assignment (before server response)
Step 3: Verify server confirmation updates state
Step 4: Verify no flicker or revert if successful
Step 5: Test with simulated slow network to confirm optimistic behavior

description: J key navigates down in the queue
steps: Step 1: Navigate to the moderation queue
Step 2: Ensure focus is on the queue (not in an input field)
Step 3: Press the J key
Step 4: Verify selection moves to the next post down
Step 5: Press J again to continue navigation
Step 6: Verify navigation wraps or stops at end of list

description: K key navigates up in the queue
steps: Step 1: Navigate to the moderation queue
Step 2: Navigate down a few posts
Step 3: Press the K key
Step 4: Verify selection moves to the previous post up
Step 5: Verify navigation wraps or stops at beginning of list

description: Enter key opens selected post and auto-assigns
steps: Step 1: Use J/K to select a post in the queue
Step 2: Press Enter key
Step 3: Verify post detail view opens in work pane
Step 4: Verify post is auto-assigned to current agent
Step 5: Verify focus moves appropriately to detail view

description: Escape key closes detail view and returns to queue
steps: Step 1: Open a post in detail view
Step 2: Press the Escape key
Step 3: Verify detail view closes
Step 4: Verify focus returns to the queue
Step 5: Verify previously selected post is still highlighted

description: Cmd+Shift+A opens reassign menu
steps: Step 1: Open a post that is assigned to current agent
Step 2: Press Cmd+Shift+A (or Ctrl+Shift+A on Windows)
Step 3: Verify reassign menu/dialog opens
Step 4: Verify list of available agents is displayed
Step 5: Verify can select an agent or cancel

description: Cmd+K opens global command palette
steps: Step 1: From anywhere in the application
Step 2: Press Cmd+K (or Ctrl+K on Windows)
Step 3: Verify command palette modal opens
Step 4: Verify search input is focused
Step 5: Type to filter available commands
Step 6: Verify commands are filterable and selectable
Step 7: Press Escape to close palette

description: Keyboard focus states are clearly visible
steps: Step 1: Navigate the application using only keyboard (Tab, arrows, shortcuts)
Step 2: Verify all interactive elements show visible focus rings
Step 3: Verify focus ring color is Indigo-500 (#6366f1)
Step 4: Verify focus never gets lost or trapped
Step 5: Verify focus order is logical and sequential

description: Categories can be managed by admin
steps: Step 1: Log in as Admin
Step 2: Navigate to Categories Management
Step 3: View list of existing categories
Step 4: Create a new category with name, slug, color, and icon
Step 5: Edit an existing category
Step 6: Reorder categories by position
Step 7: Deactivate a category
Step 8: Verify changes reflect in queue filters

description: Posts display correct category badge with color
steps: Step 1: Ensure categories are configured with different colors
Step 2: Navigate to the moderation queue
Step 3: Verify posts show category badges
Step 4: Verify badge colors match category configuration
Step 5: Verify category name or icon is displayed

description: API endpoint GET /api/v1/posts returns paginated queue
steps: Step 1: Make authenticated GET request to /api/v1/posts
Step 2: Verify response status is 200
Step 3: Verify response contains array of posts
Step 4: Verify posts include required fields (id, title, priority, status)
Step 5: Verify pagination metadata is included
Step 6: Verify response respects filter parameters

description: API endpoint GET /api/v1/posts/:id returns single post
steps: Step 1: Make authenticated GET request to /api/v1/posts/123
Step 2: Verify response status is 200
Step 3: Verify response contains full post details
Step 4: Verify includes body_content, author info, and activity history
Step 5: Test with non-existent ID returns 404

description: API endpoint PATCH /api/v1/posts/:id updates post
steps: Step 1: Make authenticated PATCH request to /api/v1/posts/123
Step 2: Include update data (status, priority) in body
Step 3: Verify response status is 200
Step 4: Verify response contains updated post
Step 5: Verify changes are persisted in database
Step 6: Verify unauthorized updates are rejected

description: API endpoint POST /api/v1/posts/:id/assign assigns post to agent
steps: Step 1: Make authenticated POST request to /api/v1/posts/123/assign
Step 2: Verify response status is 200
Step 3: Verify post assigned_to_id is set to current agent
Step 4: Verify assigned_at timestamp is set
Step 5: Verify audit log entry is created

description: API endpoint POST /api/v1/posts/:id/release releases post assignment
steps: Step 1: Assign a post to current agent
Step 2: Make authenticated POST request to /api/v1/posts/123/release
Step 3: Verify response status is 200
Step 4: Verify post assigned_to_id is null
Step 5: Verify post appears in unassigned queue

description: API endpoint GET /api/v1/posts/search performs full-text search
steps: Step 1: Make GET request to /api/v1/posts/search?q=searchterm
Step 2: Verify response status is 200
Step 3: Verify results contain posts matching search term
Step 4: Verify search covers title and body_content
Step 5: Verify empty search returns appropriate response

description: API endpoint POST /api/v1/posts/:id/responses creates new response
steps: Step 1: Make authenticated POST to /api/v1/posts/123/responses
Step 2: Include response content in body
Step 3: Verify response status is 201
Step 4: Verify response is saved with correct post_id and agent_id
Step 5: Verify is_internal_note flag is respected

description: API endpoint POST /api/v1/ai/suggest generates AI response
steps: Step 1: Make authenticated POST to /api/v1/ai/suggest
Step 2: Include post_id and context in request body
Step 3: Verify response is streaming (SSE or chunked)
Step 4: Verify AI-generated content is relevant to post
Step 5: Verify RAG retrieval provides similar responses as context

description: API endpoint POST /api/v1/ai/analyze-sentiment returns sentiment
steps: Step 1: Make POST to /api/v1/ai/analyze-sentiment
Step 2: Include text content in request body
Step 3: Verify response contains sentiment_score (-1 to 1)
Step 4: Verify response contains sentiment_label (negative/neutral/positive)
Step 5: Verify analysis is accurate for clearly positive/negative text

description: Supabase Realtime subscription connects successfully
steps: Step 1: Load the moderation queue page
Step 2: Open browser developer tools network tab
Step 3: Verify WebSocket connection is established to Supabase
Step 4: Verify subscription to posts table is active
Step 5: Verify heartbeat messages are exchanged

description: Vector embeddings are generated for new posts
steps: Step 1: Create or ingest a new post via API
Step 2: Verify post is created successfully
Step 3: Check that embedding column is populated
